alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Kane (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 6:18PM CDT until March 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KANE...DUPAGE AND NORTHWESTERN COOK COUNTIES... At 618 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Elburn, or near Geneva, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Naperville, Elgin, Schaumburg, Wheaton, Hoffman Estates, Downers Grove, Elmhurst, Lombard, Bartlett, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Addison, Glendale Heights, Elk Grove Village, St. Charles, Glen Ellyn, West Chicago and Batavia. This includes... Schaumburg Boomers Baseball, College of DuPage, DuPage County Fairgrounds, Elgin Community College, Fermilab, IL Math and Science Academy, Kane County Cougars Ballpark, Morton Arboretum, Waubonsee Community College, and Wheaton College. Including the following interstates... I-88 between mile markers 108 and 139. I-290 between mile markers 4 and 15. I-355 between mile markers 19 and 30. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
